title: Eagle brooches: 1,500-year-old pins filled with dazzling gems and glass — and worn by powerful Visigoth women
summary: Visigoth women may have worn eagle-shaped pins as a symbol of power.

title: How long does DNA last?
summary: The world's oldest DNA comes from a 2.4 million-year-old ecosystem in Greenland. Will scientists eventually sequence even older DNA?

title: إيقاف بارون مخدرات بالناظور
summary: تمكنت مصالح الشرطة القضائية التابعة للأمن الجهوي بالناظور، أخيرا، من إيقاف شخص يشكل موضوع مذكرة بحث وطنية صادرة ضده منذ 2020، على خلفية تورطه في محاولة تهريب كميات كبيرة من مخدر الحشيش انطلاقا من سواحل إقليم الحسيمة. وأكدت مصادر مطلعة أن الموقوف ظل متواريا عن الأنظار منذأكمل القراءة » المقالة إيقاف…
body: تمكنت مصالح الشرطة القضائية التابعة للأمن الجهوي بالناظور، أخيرا، من إيقاف شخص يشكل موضوع مذكرة بحث وطنية صادرة ضده منذ 2020، على خلفية تورطه في محاولة تهريب كميات كبيرة من مخدر الحشيش انطلاقا من سواحل إقليم الحسيمة. وأكدت مصادر مطلعة أن الموقوف ظل متواريا عن الأنظار منذ أكمل القراءة » المقالة إيقاف بارون مخدرات بالناظور fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Want to do disruptive science? Include more rookie researchers
summary:
Nature, Published online: 29 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03117-1

Papers from research teams with a substantial number of beginners are highly disruptive and innovative, study shows.
body: Nature, Published online: 29 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03117-1 Papers from research teams with a substantial number of beginners are highly disruptive and innovative, study shows.

title: 30,000-year-old 'personal toolkit' found in the Czech Republic provides 'very rare' glimpse into the life of a Stone Age hunter-gatherer
summary: Archaeologists have found an extraordinary cluster of Stone Age artifacts that may have been the personal gear of a single prehistoric individual.

title: James Webb Space Telescope reveals thick cosmic dust of Sagittarius B2, the most enormous star-forming cloud in the Milky Way — Space photo of the week
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has uncovered dazzling newborn stars and thick cosmic dust in Sagittarius B2, the Milky Way's most enormous star-forming cloud.

title: Science history: Rosetta stone is deciphered, opening a window into ancient Egyptian civilization — Sept. 27, 1822
summary: On Sept. 27, 1822, French philologist Jean-François Champollion announced that he had deciphered ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics, using the Rosetta stone. This ushered in a new craze for Egyptology and helped us understand one of the world's longest-running civilizations.

title: The LA Fires Spewed Out Toxic Nanoparticles. He Made It His Mission to Trace Them
summary: Nicholas Spada is one of the only scientists in the world using a nuclear x-ray process to study deadly nanoparticles in wildfire smoke. What he’s uncovered in California is a nightmare.

title: It's official: Humans have found 6,000 planets beyond our solar system
summary: Just two decades after astronomers discovered the first exoplanet, NASA has confirmed the existence of 6,000 alien worlds. The total will rise even quicker as next-generation telescopes take flight.

title: 'If there is a space race, China's already winning it': NASA unlikely to bring Mars samples back to Earth before China does, experts say
summary: "If there is a space race, China's already winning it, and could win it dramatically in the next few decades."

title: NASA launches special mission to study Earth's mysterious "halo"
summary: NASA's Carruthers Geocorona Observatory has taken flight, and will soon start a two-year mission to study Earth's mysterious "halo".

title: China pledges to cut emissions by 2035: what does that mean for the climate?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03166-6

The country’s plan to reduce greenhouse gases will largely determine the world’s emissions trajectory, researchers say.
body: Nature, Published online: 26 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03166-6 The country’s plan to reduce greenhouse gases will largely determine the world’s emissions trajectory, researchers say.

title: Rare wampum beads discovered at 17th-century colony in Newfoundland
summary: Archaeologists in Newfoundland have discovered seven tiny beads known as wampum that are made from seashells. They may be the first ever found in the province.

title: 1 million-year-old skull from China holds clues to the origins of Neanderthals, Denisovans and humans
summary: Reconstruction of a 1 million-year-old skull shows that early human groups split and diversified quickly.

title: Mystery creature found in 'forbidden cloud forest' of Peru is new species of marsupial
summary: The newly described mouse opossum was discovered at a surprisingly high altitude in the Andes.

title: Weird glass in Australia appears to be from giant asteroid impact — but scientists 'yet to locate the crater'
summary: Strange glass strewn across southern Australia appears to be from a mystery asteroid impact 11 million years ago.

title: Fossil of huge penguin that lived 3 million years ago discovered in New Zealand — what happened to it?
summary: The newly-discovered penguin species went extinct when the ice age hit, but researchers don't think the cold was to blame for their demise.

title: Why is autism really on the rise? What the science says
summary:
Nature, Published online: 25 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03143-z

As Trump blames Tylenol, Nature looks into the decades of research on the causes of autism.
body: Nature, Published online: 25 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03143-z As Trump blames Tylenol, Nature looks into the decades of research on the causes of autism.

title: When life gets in the way of your meticulously-planned career in science
summary:
Nature, Published online: 25 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02897-w

Julie Gould asks two mid-career researchers to reflect on how closely their professional paths have followed their original goals and ambitions.
body: Nature, Published online: 25 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02897-w Julie Gould asks two mid-career researchers to reflect on how closely their professional paths have followed their original goals and ambitions.

title: The James Webb telescope may have discovered a brand new class of cosmic object: the black hole star
summary: Using the James Webb Space Telescope, astronomers discovered an extreme version of "little red dots" dubbed "The Cliff." Its light suggests that it could be a never-before-seen class of objects called a "black hole star."

title: Microscopic baby sea urchin crawling with tubed feet is among video winners of Nikon Small World in Motion competition
summary: Stunning footage of a baby sea urchin has been awarded fifth place in the annual Nikon Small World in Motion video competition.

title: Scientists spot a baby planet being born in real time (photo)
summary: Astronomers have spotted telltale signs of a new planet actively growing out of the fog of gas and dust that surrounds it.

title: Scientists discover 85 'active' lakes buried beneath Antarctica's ice
summary: Data from ESA's Cryosat-2 satellite has revealed 85 never-before-seen, active subglacial lakes buried beneath Antarctica's ice — 58% more than were previously known.

title: Trump’s $100K visa fee for foreign talent: how will it affect researchers?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03111-7

The rollout of the H-1B visa change has sown confusion – and some fear another ‘body blow’ for US science.
body: Nature, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03111-7 The rollout of the H-1B visa change has sown confusion – and some fear another ‘body blow’ for US science.

title: Robotic system takes chemistry into hyperspace
summary:
Nature, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02821-2

Exploring multidimensional ‘landscapes’ of chemical reactions provides rich insights into how they work, and might even enable the discovery of new form…
body: Nature, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02821-2 Exploring multidimensional ‘landscapes’ of chemical reactions provides rich insights into how they work, and might even enable the discovery of new forms of reactivity.

title: No lectures, exams, essays: inside a twenty-first-century university
summary:
Nature, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03034-3

Some innovative higher-education institutions are reimagining pedagogy by prioritizing local needs over research and international student recruitment. …
body: Nature, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03034-3 Some innovative higher-education institutions are reimagining pedagogy by prioritizing local needs over research and international student recruitment. Anna McKie visits one of them.

title: We could nuke 'city killer' asteroid 2024 YR4 before it hits the moon — if we act fast, new study warns
summary: The potential 'city killer' asteroid 2024 YR4 has a small chance of hitting the moon in 2032. In a new paper, scientists probe the logistics of destroying it — possibly with nuclear weapons — before it comes too close.

title: Gigantic dinosaur with 'claws like hedge trimmers' found with croc leg still in its jaws in Argentina
summary: Speedy megaraptor Joaquinraptor casali had big arms and claws like hedge trimmers that would have made T. rex's forelimbs look puny.

title: أوروبا تبحث تحديث قواعد ملفات الارتباط لتسهيل التصفح
summary: تسعى المفوضية الأوروبية إلى جعل تصفح الإنترنت أكثر سهولة، عبر تخفيف قواعد الخصوصية، وإيجاد طريقة جديدة لإدارة ملفات الارتباط (الكوكيز).

title: جوائز "نوبل" الساخرة تكرّم أصحاب أغرب البحوث والاختراعات
summary: حصلت اختراعات من بينها طلاء الأبقار بخطوط الحمير الوحشية لإبعاد الذباب عنها، وطهو الصلصة الإيطالية من دون تكوّن كِتل، على مكافآت نسخة ساخرة من جوائز "نوبل"، تحتفي بالبحث العلمي ولكن بطريقة مرحة.

title: شهادة مدير "إف بي آي" تحسم قضية إبستين.. ماذا قال؟
summary: أكد مدير مكتب التحقيقات الفدرالي "إف بي آي"، كاش باتيل، الثلاثاء، أنه لا توجد "معلومات موثوقة" في الملفات القضائية تشير إلى أن الممول الثري جيفري إبستين، المدان بجرائم جنسية، وفّر فتيات قاصرات لأشخاص آخرين.

title: فجر الجمعة.. سماء مكة تشهد ظاهرة فلكية مهيبة
summary: تشهد سماء مكة المكرمة في غرب السعودية فجر الجمعة ظاهرة تعامد القمر الأحدب المتناقص على الكعبة المشرفة في حدث فلكي يجمع بين الدقة العلمية والجمال البصري، ويعكس التناغم بين حركة الأجرام السماوية والمواقع الأرضية.
